alert.note: Alert for Butler; Grundy (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:06PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN POWESHIEK...BLACK HAWK...EASTERN TAMA...BREMER... NORTHEASTERN GRUNDY AND EASTERN BUTLER COUNTIES... At 506 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nashua to near Waterloo Municipal Airport to 4 miles south of Chelsea, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Waterloo, Cedar Falls, Waverly, Evansdale, Jesup, La Porte City, Hudson, Sumner, Denver, Traer, Clarksville, Dysart, Tripoli, Shell Rock, Elk Run Heights, Crossroads Mall, Waterloo Municipal Airport, Uni-Dome And McLeod Center, Janesville and Washburn. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 56 and 73. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, north central and northeastern Iowa. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
